translation: Now begins the description of war with Kharag Singh

gurmukhi: iqh BUpiq ko im`qR iek KVg isMG iqh nwm ]pYry smr smuMdR bhu mhwNrQI bl Dwm ]1370]
transliteration: Tih Bhoopat(i) Ko Mittra Ik Khadag Singh Tih Naam|| Paire Samar Samounndra Bahu Mahaanrathibal Dhaam||1370||
translation: A friend of that king named Kharag Singh was there, who was an excellent swimmer of the ocean of war and an abode of great strength.1370.

gurmukhi: kRu`Dq hÍY Aiq mn ibKY cwr BUp iqh swQ ]ju`Du krin hir isau cilXo Aimq sYn lY swQ ]1371]
transliteration: Kruddhat Hvai At(i) Man Bikhai Chaar Bhoop Tih Saath|| Juddh(u) Karan(i) Sio Chaliyo Amit Sain Lai Saath||1371||
translation: Taking four kings and innumerable forces alongwith him, he, in great ire, went for war with Krishna.1371.

gurmukhi: KVg isMG br isMG Aaur niRp gvn isMG br ]Drm isMG Bv isMG bfy blvMq ju`Du kr ]
transliteration: Khadag Singh Bar Singh Aur Nrip Gadan Singh Bar Dharam Singh Bhav Singh Bade Balvant Juddh(u) Kar||
translation: There were many warriors there including Kharag Singh, Bar Singh, Gavan Singh, Dharam Singh, Bhav Singh etc.,

gurmukhi: rQ Anyk sMg lIey suBt bhu bwjq s`jq ]ds hzwr gjm`q cly GnIAr ijm g`jq ]
transliteration: Rath Anek San Leee Soubhat Bahu Baajat Sajjat|| Das Hazaar Gadmatt Chale Ghaneear Jim Gadjat||
translation: He took with himself many chariots and warriors; ten thousand of elephants moved thundering like clouds;

gurmukhi: imil Gyir lIXo iqn kau iqno su kib sXwm jsu liK lIXo ]irp pwvs mY Gn Gtw ijau Gor mno nr bolIXo ]1372]
transliteration: Mil(i) Gher(i) Leeyo Tin Kau Tino Su Kabi Syaam Jas(u) Lakh(i) Liyo|| Rip Paavas Mai Ghan Ghataa Jio Ghor Mano Nar Boleeyo||1372||
translation: They collectively besieged Krishna and his army; the enemy’s army was thundering and roaring like the dense clouds in the rainy season.1372.

gurmukhi: jwdv kI sYnw huqy inksy BUp su cwr ]nwm srs isMG bIr isMG mhwN isMG swr ]1373]
transliteration: Jaadav Kisinaa Houte Nikse Bhoop Su Chaar|| Naam Saras Singh Beer Singh Mohaan Singh Saar||1373||
translation: From this side, from the army of Yadavas, four kings came forward, whose names were Saras Singh, Vir Singh, Maha Singh and Saar Singh.1373.

gurmukhi: KVg isMG ky sMg niRp cwr cwr mq vMq ]hir kI Er cly mno AwXo ienko AMq ]1374]
transliteration: Khadag Singh Ke San Nrip Chaar Mat Vant|| Har(i) Kior Chale Mano Aayo Inko Ant||1374||
translation: There were four intoxicated kings with Kharag Singh; they marched towards Krishna like the persons nearing their final doom.1374.

gurmukhi: srs mhw Aau swr pun bIr isMG ey cwr ]jwdvsYnw qy qbY inksy Aiq bil Dwr ]1375]
transliteration: Saras Mahaaau Saar Poun Beer Singh E Chaar|| Jaadav-sainaa Te Tabai Nikse At(i) Bal(i) Dhaar||1375||
translation: Coming out from the army of Yadavas, Saras Singh, Maha Singh, Saar Singh and Vir Singh came in their powerful form.1375.

gurmukhi: hir kI ids ky cqur niRp iqn vh lIny mwr ]KVg isMG Aiq kop kir dIno ienih sMGwr ]1376]
transliteration: Har(i) Kidis Ke Chatur Nrip Tin Vah Leene Maar|| Khadag Singh At(i) Kop Kar(i) Deeno Inah(i) Sanhaar||1376||
translation: Kharag Singh killed in his fury all the four kings from the side of Krishna.1376.
